item.description:
We can take up to 30 people (and their dogs), so please come and join us as we've had a few cancellations.   

 For all of you that are going... my number is (860) 861-1511.  Please give me a call for any RSVP updates or questions.  Can't wait for tomorrow!!!

OK, final update (I HOPE!!!).  Please read all the updates below:

  • We are set up for 10:00 May 14th. 
  • Please update your RSVP if you cannot or are not going on Saturday  ASAP. Anybody who wants to go on Sunday may want to call the captain (see the website), it sounds like he may also be able to go on Sunday.
  • There is a leash law, but since we should be the only ones on the island, it shouldn't be a big deal.  I can't really say much more- there is a leash law, I can't advise you to break the law.  However, I also know we will probably be the only ones on the island.
  • It's $35 per person (this does not include any sort of tip), 1 dog per person.  This will be important because of space issues- please let me know if you have more or less than one dog per person.We may be able to fit a couple of extra dogs.  So if you have more people than dogs or vice versa, please let me know and we'll work it out.  Sounds like we're good for the numbers at this point with the people who have let me know they have an extra dog.
  • Because of all the people who have signed up to go, we are going to take 2 boats.  Because we're going to take 2 boats, we're going to leave from Hull, MA...125 Main St.  The captain says it's a perfect place for our group of dogs- beaches and laid back- and the bar will probably be open when we get back.
  • It's going to be about a 20 minute ferry ride, and about 3 hours of island time.
  • Be sure to bring water and food for the dogs!  And probably yourself, too.
  • Please let me know if you have any questions. 
  • I can't wait to meet all of you!  This is going to be a blast!


Danielle
item.why: Boat ride, island time, and lots of pups to play with!
item.name: Ferry to an island
